law.catch_line: There is a Public Education Partnership Fund....

section.section: There is a Public Education Partnership Fund.

text.section: The Comptroller shall credit to the Public Education Partnership Fund any money that is received from public grants and private contributions.
The Treasurer shall invest money from the Public Education Partnership Fund for the use of the Fund, and all earnings shall be credited to the Fund.

Expenditures from the Fund shall be made pursuant to an appropriation approved by the General Assembly in the annual State budget or by the budget amendment procedure provided for in § 7-209 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.

The Fund is a continuing, nonlapsing fund that:
Is not subject to § 7-302 of the State Finance and Procurement Article; and
May not be used as a substitute for State General Fund appropriations.
The Public Education Partnership Fund is subject to audit by the Legislative Auditor as provided under § 2-1220 of the State Government Article.
